oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Aerial view of Nashville, Tennessee, circa 1940
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A postcard aerial view of downtown Nashville, circa 1940. Leading up to the 1940s, Nashville's importance as a trading center grew steadily, and the city was known to the business world as "The Commercial Capital of the Central South." The Jefferson Street Bridge and the Sparkman Street Bridge are both visible in this image. The Cumberland River is depicted under them. Identifiable buildings include Hume-Fogg High School, the U.S. Customs House, and First Baptist Church. The image is bounded by Broadway and Eighth Avenue. Forms part of the Nashville Room Postcard Collection. 1 postcard : col. ; 3.5 x 5.5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Hume-Fogg High School (Nashville, Tenn.); United States Custom House (Nashville, Tenn.); First Baptist Church (Nashville, Tenn.)
